message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a new method for classification using a variant of Restricted Boltzmann Machines. It also mentions that RBMs have become a hot research topic recently, which is a characteristic of the Machine Learning sub-category. 

It could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as RBMs are a type of neural network and neural networks are often associated with AI. 

The paper mentions that RBMs have been applied to character recognition and document categorization, which are tasks related to computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) respectively. Therefore, these two sub-categories are also likely. 

Finally, the paper proposes a new method for classification, which involves optimizing an objective function. This is a characteristic of the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which focuses on optimization techniques for neural networks.
